intro: Eriphilema, commonly known as the false hellebore, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Araceae. It consists of a single species, Eriphilema pulchellum, which is native to the eastern United States. The plant is characterized by its large, showy, white to pale green spathe that encloses a spadix bearing small, inconspicuous flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and swampy areas. The botanical features of Eriphilema make it an interesting subject for studies in plant morphology and ecology.
